intro: Heterostachys olivascens, commonly known as the oliveleaf blight, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers and elliptical leaves. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Its leaves are usually dark green with a glossy surface and emit a mild, aromatic scent. The flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences and are pollinated primarily by insects.
